By  DAN STONEJune  

The NIU Board of Trustees recommended several noteworthy budgeting items at its June  meeting PERIOD

The BOT recommended allocating capital funds to repairs of the main steam tunnel from the East Heating Plant which has been deteriorating and is in need of repair said Eddie Williams executive vice president and chief of operations for Finance and Facilities PERIOD

The BOT has been requesting funding for the project since fiscal year  according to the BOT meeting handbook PERIOD The recommendation is intended to jump start the approval process to repair the main once capital funds are released Williams said PERIOD

Life safety concerns and the potential disruption of steam distribution during winter months have compelled the university to move this project up to top priority according to the meeting handbook PERIOD

If NIU does not receive funding from the capital budget the Finance Facilities and Operations Committee needs to figure out an alternative way to fund the main reconstruction said BOT Chair Cherilyn Murer PERIOD

The BOT also approved a contract for a locked rate for for the university at . a gallon PERIOD Transportation Department Manager Bill Finucane said the new price is about . cheaper per gallon PERIOD The  cost was . per gallon and the  cost was . a gallon according to the BOT minutes from June  PERIOD

The BOT also approved a  threeyear contract for medical reagents PERIOD The new contract is  more than last years contract Williams said PERIOD

Its frightening to see that kind of a continued increase in health care expenditure said trustee Manny Sanchez PERIOD

The increased cost is partially due to newly applied medical technology PERIOD

The testing Health Services is doing now is through a urine specimen as opposed to swabbing said Dr PERIOD Linda Hermann assistant vicepresident for Student Health  Wellness PERIOD You can understand why males in our population would be in favor of this kind of technology PERIOD Also it removes some barriers for students coming in for STD screening to have a urine specimen instead of a swab specimen. the BOT also recommended renaming two buildings on campus to better describe the functions of the buildings included renaming the Wesley Building as the Academic Advising Center and the Speech and Hearing Clinic as the University Police and Public Safety Building Williams said PERIOD The BOT agreed to recommend naming the new chiller plant on campus the East Campus Chilled Water Plant PERIOD The BOT votes on final approval of the recommendations at the June  meeting PERIOD
